awd_titl_txt: High Speed Networking for Connection Machine
awd_abstract_narration: This award is for the acquisition of networking equipment required              for more effective utilization of an existing Connection Machine                CM-2.  There are a number of research projects using the CM-2                   including:  visualization of parameterized Julia sets,                          computational geometry on a SIMD architecture, simulations of                   magnetic films, simulation of quantum chromodynamics, and multiple              target tracking algorithms for radar applications.                                                                                                              The effective use of a high speed, highly parallel computer                     requires high speed data links.  This award is for the construction             of a fiber optic network linking five sites at Boston University to             a large Connection Machine (CM-2).  The research supported by this              computer includes mathematical, computer science, electrical                    engineering, physics, and signal processing applications.  The                  award will make the Connection Machine more accessible and better               utilize its high speed computing capabilities.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
